definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: If robbers abounded, tax-gatherers and creditors had disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 如果盜賊蜂起，稅使和債主就消失了。

sentences.english: Rumour is already rife here as to Dr. Trefoil's successor.
sentences.chinese: 關於特雷福伊爾博士的繼任人，此間已經謠言蜂起。

sentences.english: Everywhere in the rear, unrest spreads.

definition: The people have no way to make a living (idiom, from Record of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4])/no way of getting by
the people's livelihood is reduced to destitution (idiom); a time of famine and impoverishment
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
to fall into disuse (of laws, customs etc)/to neglect
to deteriorate/to decline/to slump/also written 凌夷
the fire of war in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
the people are impoverished, their means exhausted (idiom); to drive the nation to bankruptcy
